text.sentence: Energy | North America Oil and Gas: E and P six November two thousand fifteen Stock Rating
Chesapeake reported strong operating results but unusually negative price realizations as unattractive midstream commitments exacerbate the pain of weak commodity prices.
CHK is seeking ways to improve its financial condition via asset sales, JVs or renegotiating midstream contracts ­ but asset markets may be challenging.
CHK trades at a fifteen percent premium to peers on mid cycle debt adjusted cash flow despite high leverage levels and a challenged cost structure.
CHK raised two thousand fifteen production guidance by one percent, while maintaining its E and P capital budget.
Chesapeake curtailed three hundred six mmcfepd of Marcellus and Utica volumes during threeQ due to weak pricing.
Chesapeake took several steps to strengthen financials in threeQ, but challenges remain.
The company negotiated new agreements in the Haynesville and Utica, but legacy agreements remain a burden.

CHK amended its revolving credit facility, enhancing its liquidity position through 'nineteen, and eliminated its stock dividend and drilling/financial commitments associated with Cleveland Tonkawa sale.
CHK has also eliminated dollar two hundred million in annual production and G and A expenses.
CHK is in the process of signing sale agreements for non core, non operated assets totaling dollar two hundred three hundred million.
CHK says transactions would be accretive and expects proceeds between fourQfifteen and oneQsixteen.
The sales should enable CHK to fund the required tender on its two thousand thirty five convertible debt this month with cash on hand.
Chesapeake noted the dollar one.five billion in cash it expects on its balance sheet at year end excludes the November maturity payment.
CHK highlighted strong Eagle Ford results and stressed the value of the STACK.
The company expects to see nine percent growth in the Eagle Ford this year with forty five percent lower capital.

We are Underweight CHK shares due to very low commodity price realizations driven by unfavorable contract arrangements and a challenging price environment.
We are concerned about the company's financial leverage and think CHK's ability to grow on pace with peers could be challenged if cash flows are strained.
Our upside case assumes a dollar ten/bbl increase in our mid cycle WTI estimate and dollar .fifty
Our downside case assumes a dollar ten/bbl reduction in our mid cycle WTI estimate and dollar .fifty

Chesapeake's threeQ results were strong, but weak realizations and a high debt level still present challenges Chesapeake Energy's threeQ operational results were strong, and the company took several steps to improve its financial stability.
We believe investors remain concerned about onerous midstream contracts causing weak price realizations, and the company's high debt burden.
CHK shares trade at a fifteen percent premium to peers on mid cycle debt adjusted cash flow despite being the most highly levered name in our coverage at over eightx net debt to forward EBITDA.
We expect a sizable outspend this year and subpar balance sheet adjusted growth next year.
We remain Underweight the shares and maintain our dollar five price target.
Chesapeake took several steps to improve its financial stability in threeQ.
The company executed new gathering agreements in the Haynesville and Dry Gas Utica, but the legacy cost of service agreements remain spread throughout many other plays.
CHK also secured an amended revolving credit facility, enhancing its liquidity position through two thousand nineteen.
In addition, Chesapeake also eliminated its stock dividend as well as drilling and financial commitments associated with the sale of its Cleveland Tonkawa subsidiary.
CHK continues to reduce costs and eliminated roughly dollar two hundred million in annual production and G and A expenses.
Chesapeake is in the process of signing several sale agreements for non core, non operated assets totaling dollar two hundred three hundred million.
CHK says these transactions would be accretive to its portfolio and expects the proceeds between fourQfifteen and oneQsixteen.
The smaller non core sales should enable CHK to fund the required tender on its two thousand thirty five convertible debt this month with cash on hand.
Chesapeake noted the dollar one.five billion in cash it expects on its balance sheet at year end excludes the November maturity payment.
CHK is still pursuing larger scale asset sales and joint ventures to raise cash and/or reduce capital.
The company has a need to improve its balance sheet and provide drilling capital to exploit its large asset base.
It also needs capital to enter into transactions that would allow it to reduce the negative impact of above market infrastructure costs.
We believe CHK is considering asset sales across the Utica, Haynesville, Powder River Basin and Mid Continent.
While we agree with the company's strategy, the execution of these plans could prove challenging given commodity price volatility and wide bid/ask spreads in the M and A market.
CHK's debilitating midstream contracts have been creating very wide gas and NGL price differentials.
While we expect NGLs to turn positive in fourQ, we believe gas realizations could be negative.
We expect lower Henry Hub prices to be impacted by higher midstream cost of service agreement fees and exacerbated by minimum volume commitment penalties.
We still expect CHK to outspend its two thousand fifteen un hedged cash flow by three fourx, while growing proforma volumes just six eight percent year over year.
We expect slightly negative gas prices in fourQ and positive dollar .fifty

BAPG is expected to be twelve percent next year, which should lag peers by a sizable margin We believe Chesapeake will deliver subpar balance sheet adjusted growth of twelve percent in two thousand sixteen.
Balance sheet adjusted growth compares economic equivalent production growth to expansion in market capital deployed.
We use this as a proxy for return on new capital, and have found it correlates well with share prices.
At twelve percent, we expect CHK to lag peers in BAPG by a sizable margin.
CHK took several steps in threeQ to improve its financial stability.
Chesapeake is signing noncore, non operated asset sales, but still pursuing larger scale divestitures
CHK posted earnings and cash flow above our estimates CHK reported stronger earnings and cash flow than expected.
Chesapeake posted clean EPS of dollar, which was above our dollar estimate and dollar consensus.
CHK posted stronger oil and NGL volumes, and had stronger oil than expected.

Net loss of dollar included the following one time items, net of tax: one) dollar four.five hundred seventy two billion in impairments, two) dollar fifty eight million in unrealized losses on commodity derivatives, three) dollar fifty eight million in unrealized gains on supply contract derivatives, four) dollar forty four million in restructuring and other termination costs, and five) dollar four million of other one time ite Miss FIGURE one threeQ'fifteen Earnings vs. Estimate
Barclays | Chesapeake Energy FIGURE two Full year two thousand fifteen two thousand sixteen Estimates

Utica production is down fifteen percent sequentially in threeQ due to intentionally curtailed volumes Utica production was one hundred six mboepd during threeQ, which is fifteen percent lower than in twoQ.
Chesapeake curtailed twenty net mmboe in the Utica in threeQ due to low gas and NGL prices.

A new regional pipeline is expected to be placed in service during the fourth quarter, allowing the company to move three hundred fifty gross mmcfpd out of the basin at more competitive Gulf Coast pricing.
two thousand fifteen average well cost is dollar seven.seven million with an average completed lateral length of seven thousand nine hundred feet with forty frac stages.
This compares to the two thousand fourteen average completed well cost of dollar seven.two million with a lateral length of six thousand two hundred feet and twenty nine frac stages.
Chesapeake operated two rigs in the Utica in twoQ, down from four rigs in threeQ.
CHK expects to maintain two rigs through the remainder of the year.
Marcellus curtailments continue Marcellus production was one percent lower sequentially at eight hundred nine mmcfpd.
The company continued to curtail volumes in the Marcellus due to weak pricing stemming from pipeline constraints.
two thousand fifteen average well cost is dollar six.four million with an average completed lateral length of six thousand eight hundred feet with twenty nine frac stages.
This compares to the two thousand fourteen average completed well cost of dollar seven.five million with a lateral length of six thousand feet and twenty seven frac stages.
Chesapeake is still operating one rig in the Marcellus and expects to maintain one rig through year end.
Powder River Basin production was twenty one mboepd during threeQ, up five percent quarter overquarter.
Average completed well cost in two thousand fifteen is ten.six million with a lateral length of five thousand nine hundred feet and twenty two frag stages.
This compares to two thousand fourteen when the well cost was dollar ten.six million with an average lateral length of five thousand four hundred feet and twenty frac stages.
CHK operated one rig in the third quarter but has since released it and does not expect operate any rigs in the PRB through the end of the year.

Eagle Ford production up three percent sequentially as CHK realizes efficiencies with longer laterals and larger completions Eagle Ford volumes were one hundred eight since last quarter, up three percent sequentially.
CHK attributed the increase to efficiencies realized through longer laterals and larger completions.
The average completed well cost is dollar five.three million in two thousand fifteen with a lateral length of six thousand feet and twenty one frac stages.
This compares to two thousand fourteen when the well cost was dollar five.nine million with five thousand eight hundred fifty foot laterals and eighteen stages.
The company operated three rigs in twoQ and expects to maintain that number through yearend.
Haynesville production was six hundred thirty six mmcfpd, down five percent sequentially.
The average completed well cost in two thousand fifteen is dollar seven.seven million with five thousand foot laterals and fourteen frac stages.
This compares to a two thousand fourteen cost of dollar eight.four million with four thousand nine hundred foot laterals and fourteen stages.
CHK operated six rigs and expects to maintain that level through year end.
Production in the Mississippi Line was thirty one mboepd during threeQ, a one percent decrease over twoQ.
The average completed well cost in two thousand fifteen is dollar two.eight million with lateral length of four thousand five hundred feet and nine stages.
This compares to two thousand fourteen when the average completed well costs was dollar three. million with a lateral length of four thousand four hundred fifty feet and nine stages.
Chesapeake has identified multiple stacked liquids rich opportunities in the Oklahoma STACK.
During threeQ, the company drilled its first two wells targeting the Meramec formation, and is currently drilling its third well.
Chesapeake released its Mississippi Lime rig for the year but intends to keep one rig in the STACK through year end.
multiple on our forward year hedge adjusted pre interest cash flow estimate to obtain an implied Enterprise Value .
The estimate for forward year PICF is based on a benchmark natural gas price forecast of dollar three.twenty
To calculate a target stock market value, we subtract projected year end two thousand fifteen net and year end FASone hundred forty three asset retirement obligation.
Our target EV is based on two thousand sixteen PICF before hedging impacts; and our price target treats estimated hedge gains/losses as a financial instrument .

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.

Valuation Methodology: Our dollar five price target is derived by applying an eight.fivex
multiple on our forward year hedge adjusted pre interest cash flow estimate to obtain an implied Enterprise Value .
We have reduced EV to reflect FAS one hundred forty three asset retirement obligation and have also subtracted estimated YEtwo thousand fifteen net debt.
Our target EV is based on two thousand sixteen PICF before hedging impacts and our price target treats estimated hedge gains/losses as a financial instrument .

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: Materially different commodity prices, production levels, or leverage from our estimates would pose a risk to the achievement of our price target.
The company's production levels are impacted by a variety of factors including drilling success, reservoir performance and future acquisitions.
Our target price is based on a forward year firm value to delevered cash flow multiple.
